description.narrative: Main/implementation phase: ILO and ISKUR to establish a programme for women's active inclusion in the labour market through programmes of skills training, active contacts with the private vsector, establishment of policies. the project has also an inception phase 55020064.

Program för integration av kvinnor på arbetsmarknaden: More and Better Jobs for Women: Women's Empowerment trough Decent work in Turkey. Programmet har föregåtts av en inceptionsfas, 55020064. Genomförandeorganisation är ILO i samarbete med ISKUR (Turkish Employment Agency).

Outcome 1: Employment policies benefiting women developed and implemented within the framework of decent work and gender equality Outcome 2: Employability of women increased and unemployed women enter the labour market through effective job counseling and active labour market policies (ALMPs) Outcome 3: ILO’s rights-based approach integrated into vocational training programmes and awareness raised on gender equality and labour standards

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

tag.narrative: 5.4 - Erkänna och värdesätta obetalt omsorgs- och hushållsarbete genom att tillhandahålla offentliga tjänster, infrastruktur och socialt skydd samt genom att främja delat ansvar inom hushållet och familjen, i enlighet med vad som är nationellt lämpligt.

5.4 - Recognize and value unpaid care and domestic work through the provision of public services, infrastructure and social protection policies and the promotion of shared responsibility within the household and the family as nationally appropriate.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The project has managed to establish highly important mechanisms and structures to ensure also the sustainability of the project results. The most important outcome has been the development and implementation of the Turkey’s first action Plan on Women’s Employment (2016-2018). The action plan was one of the recommendations of CEDAW for Turkey. It is the first of its kind not only in terms of its focus on women’s employment but also in terms of the way it was developed, as an exemplary case of social dialogue involving public agencies, employer and employee organizations and women’s civil society organizations. Following this result, another important outcome was the assignment of Gender Focal Points to each 81 provinces of Turkey in order to accelerate the implementation of the National Action Plan. A “Gender Equality Monitoring and Evaluation Commission” composed of representatives from all service units, was established within ISKUR General Directorate for the development and monitoring of gender-responsive public employment services across ISKUR. Additionally, ISKUR developed Provincial Action Plans on Women’s Employment in the pilot provinces of Ankara, Bursa, Istanbul and Konya through its provincial directorates which ensured its localization and implementation. For fostering individual and institutional capacity development of ISKUR on gender equality issues, within ISKUR General Directorate, a team of gender trainers with technical supportprovided by the project was established. Also, the Director-General issued an official call to all staff to mainstream gender equality perspective into all public employment services in line with the principles of NAP (the implementation duration finished in May 2018). The project has also built capacity of many partners and target groups. One innovative approach was the blending of vocational training programmes with women empowerment efforts under the Human Rights Education Programme developed by WWHR. The project has also worked on raising awareness of employees, public officials and the general public about women’s human rights and gender equality particularly in the workplace through I am supporting equality” seminars for women and men. The entrepreneurship programme(EP) has helped women to start up their own businesses under the “Women Entrepreneurship Development Programme” n the pilot provinces of the Project. Under the programme 400 women received entrepreneurship trainings and mentorship support.However, the evaluation report of ILO makes no significant success attribution to the EP. As per above the project has materialised its all outcomes at diiferent levels however is assessed to be a highly successful contribution despite the political and economic challenges faced during the implementation.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
